website_summaries.verdict: The 8-inch Huawei MediaPad M3 Lite 8 is a classy-looking tablet with a sharp screen and good speakers, but it's a bit pricey for what you get.

customer_reviews.title: Bridges gap between cheap and premium tabs
customer_reviews.text: Its a slow processor in a premium shell and wonderful full HD screen. Thin and light it does all I need, including playing / decoding H265 HD movies ... I don't play latest games, and if I did wouldn't do it on a tab. Its the obvious step up from £100 tabs like Amazon Fire, and those not wanting to spend £300+ on Apple or Samsung offerings. Its 16:9 screen is perfect for video, movies, books, net browsing ... unlike the silly square aspect ratios of its Samsung and Apple rivals.
customer_reviews.author: Laura eva

customer_reviews.title: Excellent hardware let down by bloatware
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace my broken Nexus and noted from other comments that many were happy with this as a replacement. The hardware is beautifully designed and crafted, the screen is excellent and so is the sound quality. For my purposes though the irremovable bloatware on this device damages the usability of Android to the point where I would never use it. To find that a Facebook app cannot be removed because it is required by the system was for me the last straw. Sadly, after being an Amazon customer since the beginning, this has become the first product that I've had to return, luckily the process seems simple enough.

customer_reviews.title: Lovely

I'm quite happy buying an Huawei tablet as we already have two Honor (Huawei) phones which we're very pleased with. product_meta.title: HUAWEI 53019354 MediaPad M3 Lite 8 – 8" Android 7.0 Tablet, FHD IPS Display with Eye-Comfort Mode, 32GB, 8MP Front and Rear Camera, 4800mAh, Children's Corner, Grey
product_meta.description:
HUAWEI MediaPad M3 Lite 8 (MediaPad M3 Lite 8 for short) is an 8.0-inch tablet that incorporates a high-performance octa-core processor (MSM8940) and Wi-Fi data connections.
